contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|nectar}} '''[[Nectar]]''', in its most common modern use, refers to the sugar-rich liquid produced by the flowers of plants in order to attract pollinating animals. '''Nectar''' was originally a name of the food or drink of the gods in Greek mythology; see [[ambrosia]]. It may also refer to: *[[Nectar (drink)]], a fruit juice beverage *[[Nectar, Alabama]], a town in central Alabama *[[Nectar Covered Bridge]], a former covered bridge in Alabama *[[Nectar loyalty card]], a loyalty card issued by a partnership of United Kingdom retailers * Nectar, a fictional performance-enhancing drug in [[Free Radical Design]]'s PS3 game, [[Haze (video game)|HAZE]] ==See also== *[[Nectar source]], a flowering plant that produces nectar *[[Mare Nectaris]], the Sea of Nectar, a geographic feature of the Moon *[[Nektar]], a 1970s English/German progressive rock band based in Germany *[[Nectar Lifesciences]], an Indian pharmaceutical organisation {{disambig}}
